feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 03 at 10:28PM AKST until December 05 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LONG DURATION HEAVY SNOW EVENT FOR THE HIGHWAYS... .A gale force low will move into the Gulf of Alaska Monday. The associated front will track north, bringing the panhandle preciptiation. The northerly winds in Northern Lynn Canal are expected to keep the cooler air in place, so when the precip collides with the cooler air, moderate to heavy snow will result
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 03 at 2:49PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Unsettled Weather for the West Coast Tuesday Through Friday... A cold low originating from Siberia will bring in a series of strong frontal-low pressure systems into the West Coast and Bering Strait beginning Tuesday. The first low Tuesday will mainly have impacts for Saint Lawrence Island with snow squalls and gale force wind gusts from the west. A stronger front moves in
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bering Strait Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Shishmaref; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island; Yukon Delta Coast

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued December 03 at 3:34PM HST until December 04 at 6:00PM HST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI AND NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... .A passing northwest (320 degree) long period swell will keep surf at or above advisory levels along north and west-facing shores. This swell peaked today but will be followed by a larger northwest swell beginning Monday night.

entry.summary: .Moderate to heavy rain and melting snow with a warm and moist atmospheric river event will lead to rises on rivers, small creaks and streams. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 03 at 9:16PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ICY ROADS ARE POSSIBLE TONIGHT... Even though snow has ended, roads remain slippery in spots. Untreated roads that are wet or slushy may become ice covered and hazardous in spots as temperatures fall below freezing overnight. If you have travel plans tonight, slow down and allow a little extra time to reach your destination. Locally hazardous driving

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 03 at 10:56PM MST until December 04 at 5:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mountain snow and blowing snow possible after a brief break Sunday afternoon. Additional snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches expected tonight and Monday. Total snow accumulations will range from 1 to 3 feet, with a few isolated maximum amounts of 3 to 5 feet possible in the Sierra Madres.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range
